comments:

exceptions were logged. The operations appeared to succeed.

The stack trace shows that you were modifying installed JRE preferences, not 
deleting launch configurations. Is that correct?
However, I still see the bug....

My mistake. I added a new JRE before deleting. I thought it was the delete that 
triggered the exception becuase it took longer then expected.

Fixed in LaunchManager.LaunchesNotifier. We now check for an empty collection 
before firing change notification. The problem was caused by "unregistered" 
processes firing change notification to the launch manager, which then filtered 
the list to contain only registered launches (empty), and then fired the change 
notification to listeners.
*** Bug 30648 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
